(49) 16726th July, 1949CABINETOFFICES OF PROFIT UNDER THE CROWNNote by the Prime minister it is desirable to use Members of Parliament wherever possible on Committeesand public bodies. Their service is an advantage to the Committees; it gives the individuals themselves useful experience; and it pleases Parliament as awhole. At the same time it is imperative that Members should not be exposed to the risk of disqualification through any infringement of the Statute dealingwith the holding of Offices of Profit under the Crown. The law in regard tothese matters is very complicated and in order to avoid the risk of disqualificationMinisters should consult the Law Officers before making any of these appointments.C. R. A.10 Downing Street, S. W. 1,26th July, 1949.37334
